body:

- Fill out the following repro template

If it's not a bug, please remove the template and elaborate the issue in your own words.
-->

Steps to reproduce
------------------

Launch `./PowerShell-6.0.0-beta.1-x86_64.AppImage`. Type anything, e.g. `exit`

Expected behavior
-----------------

```PS /home/alex> exit```

Actual behavior
---------------

```
PS /home/alex> PS /home/alex> e
               PS /home/alex> ex
               PS /home/alex> exi
               PS /home/alex> exit
```
Stdout redirection (`./PowerShell-6.0.0-beta.1-x86_64.AppImage > out`), produces file like this:
```
zenity, kdialog, Xdialog missing. Skipping /tmp/.mount_cqcHJD/usr/bin/powershell.wrapper.
PowerShell 
Copyright (C) Microsoft Corporation. All rights reserved.

PS /home/alex> eexexiexit
```

Similarly, I get this **eexexiexit** if I disable PSReadLine with `Remove-Module -Name PSReadline`.

Environment data
----------------

<!-- provide the output of $PSVersionTable -->

```powershell
> $PSVersionTable
Name                           Value                                                                                  
----                           -----                                                                                  
PSVersion                      6.0.0-beta                                                                             
PSEdition                      Core                                                                                   
BuildVersion                   3.0.0.0                                                                                
CLRVersion                                                                                                            
GitCommitId                    v6.0.0-beta.1                                                                          
OS                             Linux 4.9.20 #1-NixOS SMP Fri Mar 31 08:32:02 UTC 2017                                 
Platform                       Unix                                                                                   
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0...}                                                                
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3                                                                                    
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1                                                                                
WSManStackVersion              3.0                                                                                    
```
I launch AppImage file with
```
LD_LIBRARY_PATH=~/.nix-profile/lib:/run/current-system/sw/lib/:/nix/store/2ha6ykgqyqdd2dvaxj76ijnsv42zv68c-util-linux-2.29.2/lib/ ./PowerShell-6.0.0-beta.1-x86_64.AppImage
```

comments.author: probonopd
comments.body: Can you reproduce this on any other system but NixOS?

comments.author: richsmith92
comments.body: @probonopd I tried AppImage on two Debian systems and also a docker version on my NixOS. All of them work fine. Only AppImage on NixOS has this problem.

comments.author: richsmith92
comments.body: Also I just noticed that `Up/Down` keys don't work for browsing history. But `Ctrl-p/Ctrl-n` work.

comments.author: au-phiware
comments.body: I also observe this behaviour in a docker container based on microsoft/powershell:centos7. It appears to be related to the width of my terminal (new lines appears after a certain length dependent on the width of the window). Also the flashing cursor doesn't align with the text.

comments.author: msftbot[bot]
comments.body: This issue has been marked as external and has not had any activity for **1 day**. It has been be closed for housekeeping purposes.

title: On keyboard input, every new character adds a new line
